content: दिश् {c6c} <ab>U.</ab> (दिशति-ते, दिष्ट; {%<ab>desid.</ab>%} दिदिक्षति-ते) {@--1@} To point out, show, exhibit, produce (as a witness); साक्षिणः संति मेत्युक्त्वा दिशेत्युक्तो दिशेन्न यः <ls>Ms. 8. 57</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 8.">52</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 8.">53.</ls> {@--2@} To assign, allot; इष्टां गतिं तस्य सुरा दिशांति <ls>Mb.</ls> {@--3@} To give, grant, bestow upon, deliver or make over to; बाणमत्रभवते निजं दिशन् <ls>Ki. 13. 68</ls>; <ls>R. 5. 30</ls>, <ls n="R. 5.">11</ls>, <ls n="R. 5.">2</ls>, <ls n="R.">16. 72.</ls> {@--4@} To pay (as tribute). {@--5@} To consent to; <ls>R. 11. 49.</ls> {@--6@} To direct, order, command. {@--7@} To allow, permit; स्मर्तुं दिशंति न दिवः सुरसुंदरीभ्यः <ls>Ki. 5. 28.</ls> {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} (देशयति-ते) {@--1@} To show, point out, allot, assign. {@--2@} To teach, communicate, tell, inform. {@--3@} To direct, order. {@--4@} To confer, bestow.

दिश् {%<ab>f.</ab>%} [दिशति ददात्पवकाशं दिश्-क्विप्] (<ab>Nom.</ab> <ab>sing.</ab> दिक्-ग्) {@--1@} A direction, cardinal point, point of the compass, quarter of the sky; दिशः प्रसेदुर्मरुतो ववुः सुखाः <ls>R. 3. 14</ls>; दिशि दिशि किरति सजलकणजालं <ls>Gīt. 4.</ls> {@--2@} ({%a%}) The mere direction of a thing, hint, indication (of the general lines); इति दिक् (often used by commentators &c.); इत्थं लौकिकशब्दानां दिङ्मात्रमिह दर्शितं <ls>Sk.</ls> ({%b%}) (Hence) Mode, manner, method; मुनेः पाठोक्तदिशा <ls>S. D.</ls>; दिगियं सूत्रकृता प्रदर्शिता; दासीसभं नृपसभं रक्षःसभमिमा दिशः <ls>Ak.</ls> {@--3@} Region, space, place in general. {@--4@} A foreign or distant region. {@--5@} A point of view, manner of considering a subject. {@--6@} A precept, order. {@--7@} The number ‘ten’. {@--8@} A side or party. {@--9@} The mark of a bite. ({%<ab>N. B.</ab>%} In <ab>comp.</ab> दिश् becomes दिग् before words beginning with vowels and soft consonants, and दिक् before words beginning with hard consonants; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} दिगंबर, दिग्गज, दिक्पथ, दिक्करिन्, &c.)
